detector.title: Automatic detection

help.title: Automatic Detection
help.overviewContent: Automatic detection scans all your configured services to find users with similar identifiers (email, username, ID).
help.scanContent: Click the Detect button to start the analysis. The system compares users across all enabled services and calculates a confidence score.
help.resultsContent: Results are grouped by user and sorted by confidence level (high, medium, low). Use filters to refine the list.
help.createContent: Select the desired suggestions and click Create to automatically generate the corresponding user mappings.

detector.needTwoServices: You need at least 2 enabled services to detect user mappings
detector.noMappingsDesc: No users with matching identifiers found.
detector.useManual: Create mappings manually via the "Manual Mapping" tab.
detector.selectOne: Please select at least one suggestion to create mappings

creator.title: Manual mapping

help.title: Manual Mapping
help.overviewContent: Manual mapping allows you to manually link user accounts across your different services. This is useful when automatic detection doesn't work or when you want full control.
help.enumerateContent: Click the Refresh button to load the list of users from all your configured services. Use search to filter by name or email, and the dropdown to filter by service.
help.selectContent: Click on a user to select them. You can select multiple users from different services to create a centralized mapping. Selected users appear in the panel at the top.
help.createContent: Once users are selected, click Create to generate the mapping. If multiple usernames are detected, you can choose which one to use as the central identifier.

creator.multipleUsernamesFound: Multiple usernames found. Choose which one to use:
creator.selectOneUser: Please select at least one user

list.title: Mappings

help.title: Mapping List
help.overviewContent: This page displays all existing user mappings. Each card represents a central user with their linked accounts across different services.
help.cardsContent: Each card shows the username, number of active services, and colored badges for each connected service. Hover over a badge to see details.
help.editContent: Click the pencil icon to edit a user: modify their name, add new services, or delete existing mappings.
help.syncContent: Green badges indicate active synchronization. You can enable/disable synchronization for each service individually in the details.

list.noMappingsStart: Start by detecting or creating mappings.
list.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user mapping?
list.deleteUserConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete all mappings for this user? This action cannot be undone.
list.removeServiceConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove this service mapping?

centralized.title: Centralized data
centralized.notFound: User not found or has no active mappings
